general_texts:
All transfer applicants must satisfy University of California admissions eligibility requirements as well as meeting campus admission selection criteria. Completing the UC transfer admission requirements in English and mathematics by the end of the fall term prior to the fall application quarter makes an applicant more competitive for admission to UCSB. All admission requirements must be completed by the end of spring prior to transfer. For more information on UC admissions eligibility requirements and admission to UCSB, please visit the Admissions website: www.admissions.ucsb.edu


This articulation agreement lists course-to-course or sequence-to-sequence substitutions for preparation in the major. Transfer students are strongly encouraged to complete as many major preparatory courses as possible prior to enrolling at UCSB. Completion of all major preparatory courses is not an admissions requirement, but some majors require certain courses to be completed prior to transfer with a specified GPA. Completion or near completion of major preparatory courses will help students move more efficiently toward graduation after transfer.


Please note that the course "equivalencies" do not necessarily apply to UCSB general education. For information concerning satisfaction of UCSB general education requirements, please refer to the General Education/Breadth articulation agreement.


Advanced Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) exams may or may not be used to meet course requirements, depending on the exam. Please refer to the AP Chart and IB Chart in the UCSB General Catalog for information on how we use AP and IB exams.

Please visit the department's website to learn more about this major: www.pstat.ucsb.edu


PRE-MAJOR INFORMATION


Students are admitted initially to Pre-Actuarial Science, not directly to the major. To be admitted to the full major, students must complete all pre-major courses with a 2.5 or higher UC grade-point average (in courses completed at the University of California). All pre-major courses must be completed with a grade of "C" or better. (Only UC grades go into the pre-major GPA. Transfer courses taken outside of UC may satisfy pre-major requirements, but they are not part of the pre-major GPA.) Students are permitted to repeat a maximum of two pre-major courses. Only one repeat is allowed in each course. Preparation courses are excluded from the pre-major GPA, but will apply to the overall major GPA. Students must complete Computer Science 8 and either 9 or 16 with a grade of "C" or better. Only one repeat is allowed in each Computer Science preparation for the major and pre-major requirement. Because the criteria are subject to annual review and revision, transfer students should consult the department directly to obtain current information regarding specific additional criteria for admission to the full major.

**Admission to the pre-major does not guarantee admission to full major status.**

PRE-MAJOR

  • Mathematics 3A, 3B, 4A, 4B, 6A, 6B (these courses must be completed with grades of "C" or better)
  • Mathematics 8* or PSTAT 8* (must be completed with a grade of "C" or better)
  • PSTAT 10 (must be completed with a grade of "C" or better)

*Note: Either MATH 4A, 4B, 6A, or 6B must be completed with a grade of "B" or better in order to take MATH 8 or PSTAT 8 at UCSB.

*Note: MATH 8 is a prerequisite for all upper-division Mathematics courses except MATH 117, 104A, 104B, and 104C. If you plan to take additional upper-division Mathematics courses, you must take MATH 8.


PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR

  • Computer Science 8* (must be completed with a grade of "C" or better)
  • Computer Science 9* or 16* (must be completed with a grade of "C" or better)
  • Writing 107A or 107B (these are upper-division courses that are not articulated and would be taken at UCSB)

*Note: CMPSC 9 is recommended over CMPSC 16. Also, students cannot get credit for CMPSC 8 at UCSB if transferring in credit for CMPSC 9 or 16, so please see the Department advisors in such instances.


Other recommended courses: Economics 1, 2, 3A, 10A (fulfills VEE), and Philosophy 3 or 4


(Transfer applicants do not need to complete all Pre-Major and Preparation for the Major courses in order to be admitted, but should complete as much as possible before transferring so they will be prepared to progress in the major at UCSB.)

Advisory note for fall 2027 applicants to Actuarial Science, B.S. (October-November 2026 application filing period)


NEW ADMISSION SELECTION CRITERIA FOR FALL 2027: Transfer applicants must complete the following (in addition to general admission requirements) with a minimum 2.75 GPA in these courses, with no grade lower than C. (Letter grades are required.)

  • Calculus 1 and Calculus 2 (courses articulating with UCSB's MATH 3A and 3B)
  • Linear algebra (UCSB's MATH 4A)
  • Multivariable calculus (UCSB's MATH 6A)
  • One computer programming course (UCSB's CMPSC 8 or 9 or 16)

New UCSB students will likely need more than two years to graduate if a significant amount of lower-division Mathematics pre-major courses are not completed prior to transfer. Students should complete Calculus I, Calculus II, Linear Algebra, Differential Equations, Multivariable and/or Vector Calculus, and all preparation for the major courses before transferring to UCSB if they wish to graduate within two years after transfer.

Please visit the department's website to learn more about this major: www.math.ucsb.edu


PRE-MAJOR INFORMATION


Students are admitted initially to Pre-Applied Mathematics, not directly to the major. Admission to the full major is contingent upon completion of PRE-MAJOR mathematics courses with a grade point average of 2.5 or higher in courses completed at the University of California and with no grade lower than "C". (Only UC grades go into the pre-major GPA. Transfer courses taken outside of UC may satisfy pre-major requirements, but they are not part of the pre-major GPA.) All pre-major courses and Computer Science 8 or 9 or 16 or Engineering 3 must also be completed with a grade of "C" or better. PREPARATION courses are excluded from the pre-major GPA, but will apply to the overall major GPA. Because the criteria are subject to annual review and revision, transfer students should consult the department directly to obtain current information regarding additional, specific criteria for admission to the full major. Admission to the pre-major does not guarantee admission to full major status.

ADMISSION SELECTION CRITERIA - To be admitted to the Pre-Applied Mathematics major, transfer applicants must complete the following (in addition to general admission requirements):


  1. Calculus course articulating with UCSB's MATH 3A
  2. Calculus course articulating with UCSB's MATH 3B
  3. A third math course chosen from linear algebra (UCSB's MATH 4A), differential equations (UCSB's MATH 4B), or multivariable calculus/vector calculus (UCSB's MATH 6A-B)
  4. A cumulative GPA of 2.75 or better in the required courses listed above with no individual grade lower than "C".


(This is a minimum admission requirement. Students should take as many pre-major and major preparation courses as possible before transferring in order to make timely progress to graduation.)

PRE-MAJOR REQUIREMENTS:

  • Mathematics 3A, 3B (required prior to transfer - see Admission Selection Criteria above; these courses must be completed with grades of "C" or better)
  • Mathematics 4A, 4B, 6A, 6B (at least one of these courses required prior to transfer - see Admission Selection Criteria above; these courses must be completed with grades of "C" or better)
  • Mathematics 8* (must be completed with a grade of "C" or better)


*Note: Either Math 4A, 4B, 6A, or 6B must be completed with a grade of "B" or better in order to take MATH 8 at UCSB


PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR:

  • One course from Computer Science 8, 9, 16, or Engineering 3 (must be completed with a grade of "C" or better)
  • Physics 1 or 6A or 7A or 21

Department of Ecology, Evolution, and Marine Biology (EEMB) majors:

  • Aquatic Biology, B.S.
  • Biological Sciences, B.A. & B.S.
  • Ecology and Evolution, B.S.
  • Physiology, B.S.
  • Zoology, B.S.


Department of Molecular, Cellular, and Developmental Biology (MCDB) majors:

  • Biological Sciences, B.A. & B.S.
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S.
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Biochemistry-Molecular Biology Emphasis
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Cell and Developmental Biology Emphasis
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Microbiology Emphasis
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Pharmacology Emphasis


PRE-MAJOR INFORMATION - Students are admitted initially to Pre-Biological Sciences if they applied to any of these majors, not directly to the major. Admission to the full major is contingent upon achievement of a grade point average of 2.0 or better in pertinent courses completed at the University of California. Because the criteria are subject to annual review and revision, interested students should consult the department directly to obtain current information regarding specific additional criteria for admission to the full major.

**Admission to the pre-major does not guarantee admission to full major status**

ADMISSION SELECTION CRITERIA - To be admitted to the Pre-Biological Sciences major, all transfer students must complete the following (in addition to general admission requirements) by the end of spring prior to transfer:


  1. One-year sequence of General Chemistry with laboratory, with no individual grade lower than "C"
  2. Complete sequence of major-applicable General Biology with laboratory, with no individual grade lower than "C"
  3. Calculus courses articulating with UCSB's MATH 3A-3B or MATH 34A-34B with no individual grade lower than "C" (first semester/quarter must be completed by fall prior to transfer; a single course articulating with both MATH 34A and 34B is acceptable and it may be in progress in winter or spring prior to transfer)*
  4. One-year sequence of Organic Chemistry with laboratory with no individual grade lower than "C" (first semester/quarter must be completed by fall prior to transfer)
  5. A cumulative GPA of 2.7 or better in the required courses listed above (letter grades required)


*[Applicants intending to major in Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Biochemistry-Molecular Biology Emphasis should take courses articulating with MATH 3A-3B rather than MATH 34A-34B if possible. MATH 34A-34B would be acceptable for admission, but MATH 3A-3B are required to complete the major.]


Note: In order to make normal major progress, before transferring we also strongly recommend the completion of one year of general physics with laboratory, and a statistics course or advanced math. Any of these courses completed with a grade lower than "C" might not satisfy course prerequisites at UCSB.

Please visit the department's website to learn more about this major: www.lifesci.ucsb.edu


PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR:


  • Chemistry 1A-1B-1C-2AL-2BL or Chemistry 1A-1AL-1B-1BL-1C-1CL (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • MCDB 1A-1B-1LL and EEMB 2-2LL-3 (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • Chemistry 6AL and 109A-109B (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • Mathematics 3A-3B or 34A-34B (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • PSTAT 5LS or PSTAT 5A or Mathematics 4A (Mathematics 4A is acceptable but not recommended)
  • Physics 6A-6AL-6B-6BL-6C-6CL

PRE-MAJOR INFORMATION

Upon admission, all prospective Chemistry and Biochemistry majors are accepted into the Pre-Chemistry major. Students who have completed all pre-major coursework may petition to declare the full major immediately after the completion of their first quarter at UCSB. Transfer students need to obtain a UC GPA of 2.0 or above in each of the 6 pre-major course sequences. Only applicable UC courses will be included in this GPA calculation, regardless of course transferability. For example, if the equivalent of MATH 3A is completed prior to transferring, then a student must achieve a GPA of at least 2.0 in MATH 3B and 4A at UCSB. Admission to the pre-major does not guarantee admission to full major status.


I. PRE-MAJOR REQUIREMENTS

  • Chemistry 1A-B-C
  • Chemistry 2AL, 2BL, 3L* (or 1AL-BL-CL)
  • Chemistry 6AL-BL
  • Chemistry 109A-B-C
  • Mathematics 3A, 3B, 4A
  • Physics 7A-B-C (or 1-2-3-4)

*Chemistry 3L is unique to UCSB and no California community college course will articulate with it. Transfer students may petition after transferring to have their completed work satisfy this requirement.


II. PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR

MATH 6A and PHYS 7L (or 3L) are required for enrollment in Biophysical Chemistry (CHEM 112A-B-C at UCSB.) Biophysical Chemistry sequences start in the fall quarter; transfer students arriving at UCSB in the fall without having completed all pre-major requirements and MATH 6A and PHYS 7L (or 3L) will be unable to enroll in Biophysical Chemistry for a full year.

  • Mathematics 6A
  • Physics 7L (or 3L)
  • MCDB 1A-1B-1LL and EEMB 2


Any of these courses completed with a grade lower than "C" might not satisfy course prerequisites at UCSB.

ADMISSION SELECTION CRITERIA: Transfer applicants must complete the following (in addition to general admission requirements) with a minimum 2.85 GPA in these courses, with no grade lower than C by the end of spring prior to transfer. (Letter grades are required.)


REQUIRED FOR ADMISSION

  • Full year of general chemistry with labs (courses articulating with UCSB's CHEM 1A-1B-1C-2AL-2BL series or CHEM 1A-1AL-1B-1BL-1C-1CL series)
  • Full year of organic chemistry with labs (courses articulating with UCSB's CHEM 109A-B-C series and CHEM 6AL and 6BL)
  • Calculus I, Calculus II (courses articulating with UCSB's MATH 3A, 3B)


NOT required for admission but HIGHLY RECOMMENDED before transfer:

  • Linear Algebra (course articulating with UCSB's MATH 4A)
  • Multivariable/Vector Calculus (course articulating with UCSB's MATH 6A)
  • Full sequence of calculus-based physics for science majors with labs (courses articulating with UCSB's PHYS 7A-B-C and 7L, or PHYS 1-2-3-4 and 3L)
  • Full sequence of biology for biology majors with labs


**ADVISORY NOTE FOR FALL 2027 APPLICANTS** (October-November 2026 application filing period)

  • Linear Algebra will be required for fall 2027 admission
  • Multivariable/Vector Calculus will be required for fall 2027 admission
  • Full sequence of calculus-based physics for science majors with labs will be required for fall 2027 admission

Prospective transfer students are strongly encouraged to complete all Pre-Major and Preparation for the Major coursework prior to transfer to ensure timely progress toward the degree. Students who do not complete these requirements may experience a delay of up to one year, as they will be unable to enroll in the required upper-division course sequences and must wait until these sequences are offered again.

Department of Ecology, Evolution, and Marine Biology (EEMB) majors:

  • Biological Sciences, B.A. & B.S.
  • Ecology and Evolution, B.S.
  • Physiology, B.S.
  • Zoology, B.S.


Department of Molecular, Cellular, and Developmental Biology (MCDB) majors:

  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Biochemistry-Molecular Biology Emphasis
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Cell and Developmental Biology Emphasis
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Microbiology Emphasis
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Pharmacology Emphasis


PRE-MAJOR INFORMATION - Students are admitted initially to Pre-Biological Sciences if they applied to any of these majors, not directly to the major. Admission to the full major is contingent upon achievement of a grade point average of 2.0 or better in pertinent courses completed at the University of California. Because the criteria are subject to annual review and revision, interested students should consult the department directly to obtain current information regarding specific additional criteria for admission to the full major.

**Admission to the pre-major does not guarantee admission to full major status**

ADMISSION SELECTION CRITERIA - To be admitted to the Pre-Biological Sciences major, all transfer students must complete the following (in addition to general admission requirements) by the end of spring prior to transfer:


  1. One-year sequence of General Chemistry with laboratory, with no individual grade lower than "C"
  2. Complete sequence of major-applicable General Biology with laboratory, with no individual grade lower than "C"
  3. Calculus courses articulating with UCSB's MATH 3A-3B or MATH 34A-34B with no individual grade lower than "C" (first semester/quarter must be completed by fall prior to transfer; a single course articulating with both MATH 34A and 34B is acceptable and it may be in progress in winter or spring prior to transfer)*
  4. One-year sequence of Organic Chemistry with laboratory with no individual grade lower than "C" (first semester/quarter must be completed by fall prior to transfer)
  5. A cumulative GPA of 2.7 or better in the required courses listed above (letter grades required)


*[Applicants intending to major in Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Biochemistry-Molecular Biology Emphasis should take courses articulating with MATH 3A-3B rather than MATH 34A-34B if possible. MATH 34A-34B would be acceptable for admission, but MATH 3A-3B are required to complete the major.]


Note: In order to make normal major progress, before transferring we also strongly recommend the completion of one year of general physics with laboratory, and a statistics course or advanced math. Any of these courses completed with a grade lower than "C" might not satisfy course prerequisites at UCSB.

Please visit the department's website to learn more about this major: www.lifesci.ucsb.edu


PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR:


  • Chemistry 1A-1B-1C-2AL-2BL or Chemistry 1A-1AL-1B-1BL-1C-1CL (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • MCDB 1A-1B-1LL and EEMB 2-2LL-3 (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • Chemistry 6AL and 109A-109B (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • Mathematics 3A-3B or 34A-34B (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • One of the following: PSTAT 5LS or PSTAT 5A or Mathematics 4A
  • Physics 6A-6AL-6B-6BL-6C-6CL (Physics 6C-6CL not required for the B.A. degree)

PRE-MAJOR INFORMATION

Students are admitted initially to Pre-Biopsychology, not directly to the major. Admission to the full Biopsychology major is contingent upon fulfilling the following requirements:

  1. The courses in Area I must be completed with a grade point average of 2.7 or higher in courses completed at the University of California
  2. The courses in Area II must be completed with a grade point average of 2.0 or higher in courses completed at the University of California
  3. All courses must be completed on a letter-grade basis

Only UC grades go into the Pre-Major GPA. Transfer courses taken outside of UC may satisfy Pre-Major requirements, but they are not part of the Pre-Major GPA.

Students should complete as many of the pre-major and major preparation courses as possible prior to transfer if they wish to graduate within two years after transfer.

  • Mathematics 34A or 3A*

  • MCDB 1A and EEMB 2

  • MCDB 1B and labs: MCDB 1LL and EEMB 2LL
  • Physics 6A-6AL-6B-6BL-6C-6CL
  • Mathematics 34B or 3B

ADMISSION SELECTION CRITERIA: To be admitted to the Chemical Engineering major, all transfer applicants must complete the equivalent of the following REQUIRED courses (in addition to general admission requirements) by the end of spring prior to transfer with no grades lower than "C".   • Math 3A, 3B, 4A, 4B

  • Math 6A, 6B

Students are encouraged to complete a series (such as general chemistry, organic chemistry, or physics) at a single school to avoid missing content.

*Chemistry 3L is unique to UCSB and no California community college course will articulate with it. Transfer students may petition after transferring to have their completed work satisfy this requirement.

  • Full year of organic chemistry with labs (courses articulating with UCSB's CHEM 109A-B-C series and CHEM 6AL and 6BL)
  • Calculus I, Calculus II, Multivariable/Vector Calculus (courses articulating with UCSB's MATH 3A, 3B, 6A)
  • Full sequence of calculus-based physics for science majors with labs (courses articulating with UCSB's PHYS 7A-B-C and 7L, or PHYS 1-2-3-4 and 3L)


NOT required for admission but HIGHLY RECOMMENDED before transfer:

PRE-MAJOR INFORMATION:

Students are admitted initially to Pre-Communication, not directly to the major. Students will be admitted to full Communication major status only after they complete Communication 1, 87, 88, and 89 with no grade below C- and with a grade point average of at least 3.00 for those courses completed at the University of California. (Only UC grades go into the pre-major GPA. Transfer courses taken outside of UC may satisfy pre-major requirements, but they are not part of the pre-major GPA.) Students who take an introductory statistics course equivalent to COMM 87 at UCSB , such as PSTAT 5A or 5LS, will have that grade automatically count toward the pre-communication GPA. If students take an equivalent statistics course, they may not take COMM 87 to count toward the pre-major GPA instead.


Upon successful completion of the pre-major course requirements, students may petition to full major status, generally prior to the accumulation of 100 quarter units. Admission to the pre-major does not guarantee admission to the Communication major, regardless of the number and outcome of upper division Communication units taken.

PRE-MAJOR REQUIREMENTS

  • Communication 1
  • Communication 87 (or an equivalent introductory statistics course)
  • Communication 88
  • Communication 89


(Transfer applicants do not need to complete all of the Pre-Major Requirements in order to be admitted, but should complete as much as possible before transferring so they will be prepared to progress in the major at UCSB.)

The CCS Mathematics program is a special curriculum designed to provide a format for aspiring mathematicians to discuss and solve non-routine problems in the various areas of mathematics. The curriculum was developed to accommodate students who are able to move to a high level of mathematical inquiry at a pace faster than the usual university curriculum would allow. Since most community college mathematics courses cannot apply to the requirements for this major, transfer students typically require a minimum of three years to complete this degree. Classes in Linear Algebra, Differential Equations, and Multivariable Calculus are strongly encouraged prior to applying to join the program.


For information about this major, please visit the College of Creative Studies website: www.ccs.ucsb.edu

Department of Ecology, Evolution, and Marine Biology (EEMB) majors:

  • Aquatic Biology, B.S.
  • Biological Sciences, B.A. & B.S.
  • Ecology and Evolution, B.S.
  • Physiology, B.S.
  • Zoology, B.S.


Department of Molecular, Cellular, and Developmental Biology (MCDB) majors:

  • Biological Sciences, B.A. & B.S.
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S.
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Biochemistry-Molecular Biology Emphasis
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Cell and Developmental Biology Emphasis
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Microbiology Emphasis
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Pharmacology Emphasis


PRE-MAJOR INFORMATION - Students are admitted initially to Pre-Biological Sciences if they applied to any of these majors, not directly to the major. Admission to the full major is contingent upon achievement of a grade point average of 2.0 or better in pertinent courses completed at the University of California. Because the criteria are subject to annual review and revision, interested students should consult the department directly to obtain current information regarding specific additional criteria for admission to the full major.

**Admission to the pre-major does not guarantee admission to full major status**

ADMISSION SELECTION CRITERIA - To be admitted to the Pre-Biological Sciences major, all transfer students must complete the following (in addition to general admission requirements) by the end of spring prior to transfer:


  1. One-year sequence of General Chemistry with laboratory, with no individual grade lower than "C"
  2. Complete sequence of major-applicable General Biology with laboratory, with no individual grade lower than "C"
  3. Calculus courses articulating with UCSB's MATH 3A-3B or MATH 34A-34B with no individual grade lower than "C" (first semester/quarter must be completed by fall prior to transfer; a single course articulating with both MATH 34A and 34B is acceptable and it may be in progress in winter or spring prior to transfer)*
  4. One-year sequence of Organic Chemistry with laboratory with no individual grade lower than "C" (first semester/quarter must be completed by fall prior to transfer)
  5. A cumulative GPA of 2.7 or better in the required courses listed above (letter grades required)


*[Applicants intending to major in Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Biochemistry-Molecular Biology Emphasis should take courses articulating with MATH 3A-3B rather than MATH 34A-34B if possible. MATH 34A-34B would be acceptable for admission, but MATH 3A-3B are required to complete the major.]


Note: In order to make normal major progress, before transferring we also strongly recommend the completion of one year of general physics with laboratory, and a statistics course or advanced math. Any of these courses completed with a grade lower than "C" might not satisfy course prerequisites at UCSB.

Please visit the department's website to learn more about this major: www.lifesci.ucsb.edu


PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR:


  • Chemistry 1A-1B-1C-2AL-2BL or Chemistry 1A-1AL-1B-1BL-1C-1CL (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • MCDB 1A-1B-1LL and EEMB 2-2LL-3 (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • Mathematics 3A-3B or 34A-34B (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • One of the following: PSTAT 5LS or PSTAT 5A (Mathematics 4A is acceptable but not recommended)
  • Physics 6A-6AL-6B-6BL-6C-6CL


Note: Organic chemistry is also required prior to transfer for admission, see Admission Selection Criteria above

Note: Organic chemistry may be required by some graduate or professional schools. Consult with an advisor.

Completion or near completion of major preparatory courses will help students move more efficiently toward graduation after transfer.


Please note that the course "equivalencies" do not necessarily apply to UCSB general education. For information concerning satisfaction of UCSB general education requirements, please refer to the General Education/Breadth articulation agreement.


Advanced Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) exams may or may not be used to meet course requirements, depending on the exam. Please refer to the AP Chart and IB Chart in the UCSB General Catalog for information on how we use AP and IB exams.

Please visit the department's website to learn more about this major: www.econ.ucsb.edu


PRE-MAJOR INFORMATION

Students are admitted initially to Pre-Economics and Accounting, not directly to the major. Admission to the full major is contingent upon completion of ECON 1, 2, 3A, 3B, and 10A with a grade point average of 2.85 or above in those courses completed at the University of California and with no grade lower than C. (Only UC grades go into the pre-major GPA. Grades in courses taken outside of UC are used in the admission decision, and the courses may satisfy pre-major requirements, but they are not part of the pre-major GPA.) In addition, any remaining major preparation courses must be completed with grades of C or higher; the grades in these courses will not be used in computing the pre-major GPA but will apply to the overall major GPA. Only the first repeat of any pre-major course will be accepted by the Department of Economics in determining admission into the full major. Because the criteria are subject to annual review and revision, transfer students should consult the department directly to obtain current information regarding specific additional criteria for admission to the full major.

**Admission to the pre-major does not guarantee admission to full major status**

ADMISSION SELECTION CRITERIA - To be admitted to the Pre-Economics and Accounting major, transfer applicants must complete the following courses with a 2.75 or better grade point average, with no individual grade lower than C (in addition to general admission requirements):


  1. Microeconomics (the Advanced Placement Microeconomics exam will not satisfy this requirement)
  2. Macroeconomics (the Advanced Placement Macroeconomics exam will not satisfy this requirement)
  3. Calculus courses articulating with UCSB's MATH 3A-3B or MATH 34A-34B (a single course articulating with both MATH 34A and 34B is acceptable) MATH 3A-3B is highly recommended over MATH 34A-34B


NOTE: Applicants may be admitted to Pre-Economics and Accounting without completing Financial Accounting, but it is highly recommended that students complete the equivalent of UCSB's ECON 3A and 3B prior to transfer.

PRE-MAJOR COURSES

  • Economics 1 and 2 (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • Economics 3A and 3B
  • Economics 10A (must be taken at UCSB)


PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR

  • Math 3A-3B or Math 34A-34B (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • Economics 5 or PSTAT 120A


Note: Economics 5 and Economics 10A must be taken at UCSB.

UCSB's General Education requirements do not need to be completed prior to transfer, but students who choose to follow College of Engineering General Education should complete two to three General Education courses prior to transfer. ADMISSION SELECTION CRITERIA: To be admitted to the Electrical Engineering major, all transfer applicants must complete the equivalent of the following REQUIRED courses (in addition to general admission requirements) by the end of spring prior to transfer with no grades lower than "C". REQUIRED for admission (all of these courses must be completed with no grades lower than "C")

  • Math 3A, 3B, 4A, 4B
  • Physics 7A, 7B, 7C, 7L
  • Computer Science 9 or 16


STRONGLY RECOMMENDED advanced preparation courses (all of these courses must be completed with no grades lower than "C")

  • Chemistry 1A or Electrical and Computer Engineering 6
  • Electrical and Computer Engineering 5, 15A
  • Math 6A, 6B
  • Physics 7D

Note: Students should take as many of the Strongly Recommended courses as possible before transferring in order to make timely progress to graduation.


Additional major preparation courses

  • Electrical and Computer Engineering 3, 10A, 10AL, 10B, 10BL, 10C, 10CL, 130A, 130B, 139


Students are strongly encouraged to complete the physics series at a single school to avoid missing content.

Please visit the departments' websites to learn more about this major: www.math.ucsb.edu and www.pstat.ucsb.edu


PRE-MAJOR INFORMATION


Students are admitted initially to Pre-Financial Mathematics and Statistics, not directly to the major. Admission to the full major is contingent upon completion of all PRE-MAJOR courses with a grade point average of 2.5 or higher in courses completed at the University of California and with no grade lower than "C". (Only UC grades go into the pre-major GPA. Transfer courses taken outside of UC may satisfy pre-major requirements, but they are not part of the pre-major GPA.) All pre-major and preparation for the major courses must be completed with a grade of "C" or better. PREPARATION courses are excluded from the pre-major GPA but will apply to the overall major GPA. Because the criteria are subject to annual review and revision, transfer students should consult the department directly to obtain current information regarding specific additional criteria for admission to the full major.

**Admission to the pre-major does not guarantee admission to full major status**

New UCSB students will likely need more than two years to graduate if a significant amount of lower-division pre-major courses are not completed prior to transfer. Students should complete Calculus I, Calculus II, Linear Algebra, Differential Equations, Multivariable and/or Vector Calculus, Micro Economics, Macro Economics, and a preparation for the major Computer Science course before tansferring to UCSB if they wish to graduate within two years after transfer.

PRE-MAJOR REQUIREMENTS:

  • Economics 1 and 2 (these courses must be completed with grades of "C" or better)
  • Mathematics 3A, 3B, 4A, 4B, 6A, 6B (these courses must be completed with grades of "C" or better)
  • Mathematics 8* or PSTAT 8* (must be completed with a grade of "C" or better)


* Note: Either MATH 4A, 4B, 6A, or 6B must be completed with a grade of "B" or better in order to take MATH 8 or PSTAT 8 at UCSB.

* Note: MATH 8 is a prerequisite for all upper-division Mathematics courses except MATH 117, 104A, 104B, and 104C. If you plan to take additional upper-division Mathematics courses, you must take MATH 8.


PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR:

  • One course from Computer Science 8, 9, 16, or Engineering 3 (must be completed with a grade of "C" or better)
  • Economics 10A (must be completed with a grade of "C" or better)
  • PSTAT 10 (must be completed with a grade of "C" or better)


(Transfer applicants do not need to complete all of the Pre-Major Requirements and Preparation for the Major in order to be admitted, but should complete as much as possible before transferring so they will be prepared to progress in the major at UCSB.)

Advisory note for fall 2027 applicants to Financial Mathematics and Statistics, B.S. (October-November 2026 application filing period)


NEW ADMISSION SELECTION CRITERIA FOR FALL 2027: Transfer applicants must complete the following (in addition to general admission requirements) with a minimum 2.75 GPA in these courses, with no grade lower than C.

  • Calculus 1 and Calculus 2 (courses articulating with UCSB's MATH 3A and 3B)
  • A third math course chosen from linear algebra (UCSB's MATH 4A), differential equations (UCSB's MATH 4B), or multivariable calculus/vector calculus (UCSB's MATH 6A-B)

PRE-MAJOR INFORMATION

Students are admitted initially to Pre-Global Studies, not directly to the major. In order to qualify for admission into the Global Studies major, students must complete Global Studies 1 and 2 with a grade-point average of 2.7 or above in courses completed at the University of California. In addition, students must complete three History courses in ONE of the regions or clusters listed below with a grade-point average of at least 2.0 in courses completed at the University of California. (Only UC grades go into the pre-major GPA. Transfer courses taken outside of UC may satisfy pre-major requirements, but they are not part of the pre-major GPA.)

**Admission to the pre-major does not guarantee admission to full major status**


PRE-MAJOR:

I. Global Studies 1 and 2

II. Completion of three History courses from the following, with at least two courses from the same geographic sequence/cluster:

  • History 2A (or 4A), 2B, 2C (World)
  • History 2A (or 4A), 4B, 4C (Europe)
  • History 49A-B-C (Africa)
  • History 8A-B, 17A-B-C, 56 (Americas)
  • History 46A, 46B, 46MI, 80, 87, 88 (Asia & Middle East)

PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR:

I. One course from the following: Anthropology 2; Economics 1, 2; Environmental Studies 1, 3; Feminist Studies 20, 30; Geography 5; Political Science 6, 7; Religious Studies 1; Sociology 1

II. Completion of quarter 6 or semester 4 (or equivalent) of a modern foreign language *

III. Completion of one additional year of a modern foreign language (Option a or b below) *

  • a) SAME language as Area II: Advanced and/or upper division courses in that language *
  • b) DIFFERENT language: Beginning year of a language (the third year of high school foreign language accepted by UCSB for General Education Area B might also satisfy this requirement) *


* ASL and Latin cannot be used for the foreign language requirements


(Transfer applicants do not need to complete all of the Pre-Major Requirements and Preparation for the Major in order to be admitted, but should complete as much as possible before transferring so they will be prepared to progress in the major at UCSB.)

PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR:

A. Any four lower-division History courses

B. History 9


(Transfer applicants do not need to complete all Preparation for the Major in order to be admitted, but should complete as much as possible before transferring so they will be prepared to progress in the major at UCSB.)

Breadth Requirement: The breadth requirement may be fulfilled at the lower-division and/or upper-division level, and the same course may fulfill a chronological and regional requirement simultaneously. Articulated community college courses are all lower-division, so only the lower-division options are listed here. There are many upper-division options at UCSB. The breadth requirement can be fulfilled prior to transfer, or it can be partially fulfilled prior to transfer and completed after transfer.


Breadth Requirement Part 1 - Three courses focusing before 1800 selected from the following courses: History 2A, 2B, 4A, 4B, 17A, 46A, 49A, 87


Breadth Requirement Part 2 - At least one course in at least four of the following six categories:

A. Africa and the Middle East: History 46A, 46B, 46MI, 49A, 49B, 49C

B. Asia: History 25, 28, 80, 87, 88

C. Europe: History 4A, 4B, 4C, 20, 22

D. Latin America: History 8A, 8B, 56

E. United States: History 17A, 17B, 17C, 20

F. World History and Comparative History: History 2A, 2B, 2C, 15, 22, 28, 46A, 46B, 49A, 49B, 49C, 74

Optional emphases: Students pursuing a Bachelor of Arts in Linguistics may choose the Linguistics B.A. without an emphasis or may choose one of the following emphases: Chinese, English, French, German, Japanese, Slavic, Spanish, Language and Speech Technologies, or Speech-Language Sciences and Disorders.


PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR

  • Linguistics 20
  • Completion of the sixth quarter or fourth semester (or equivalent) in one foreign language* plus the completion of the third quarter or second semester (or equivalent) in another foreign language.** Students are encouraged to take at least one language outside the Indo-European family; however, the study of two Indo-European languages will satisfy this requirement provided both are not members of either the Germanic, Slavic, or Romance families. Native speakers of languages other than English may petition to count either English or their native language as fulfilling one of the language requirements. (Look up articulations for languages offered at your school. If the articulation is for UCSB's level 6, that may satisfy the first requirement. If the articulation is for UCSB's level 3 or higher, that may satisfy the second requirement. Chinese, Japanese, and Korean courses are not articulated at UCSB - a language proficiency exam is required.)

*To pursue an emphasis in Chinese, French, German, Japanese, Slavic, or Spanish, the two years of foreign language must be in the corresponding language. Some language emphases require additional advanced work in the language.


**Exception: the Language and Speech Technologies Emphasis does not require completion of the third quarter or second semester in another foreign language.


(Transfer applicants do not need to complete all Preparation for the Major in order to be admitted, but should complete as much as possible before transferring so they will be prepared to progress in the major at UCSB.)

Please visit the department's website to learn more about this major: www.math.ucsb.edu


PRE-MAJOR INFORMATION


Students are admitted initially to Pre-Mathematics, not directly to the major. Admission to the full major is contingent upon completion of PRE-MAJOR mathematics courses with a grade point average of 2.5 or higher in courses completed at the University of California and with no grade lower than "C". (Only UC grades go into the pre-major GPA. Transfer courses taken outside of UC may satisfy pre-major requirements, but they are not part of the pre-major GPA.) PREPARATION courses are excluded from the pre-major GPA, but will apply to the overall major GPA. Because the criteria are subject to annual review and revision, transfer students should consult the department directly to obtain current information regarding additional, specific criteria for admission to the full major. Admission to the pre-major does not guarantee admission to full major status.

New UCSB students will likely need more than two years to graduate if a significant amount of lower-division Mathematics pre-major courses are not completed prior to transfer. Students should complete Calculus I, Calculus II, Linear Algebra, Differential Equations, and all preparation for the major courses before transferring to UCSB if they wish to graduate within two years after transfer.

ADMISSION SELECTION CRITERIA - To be admitted to the Pre-Mathematics major, transfer applicants must complete the following (in addition to general admission requirements):


  1. Calculus course articulating with UCSB's MATH 3A
  2. Calculus course articulating with UCSB's MATH 3B
  3. A third math course chosen from linear algebra (UCSB's MATH 4A), differential equations (UCSB's MATH 4B), or multivariable calculus/vector calculus (UCSB's MATH 6A-B)
  4. A cumulative GPA of 2.75 or better in the required courses listed above with no individual grade lower than "C".


This is a minimum admission requirement. Students should take as many pre-major and major preparation courses as possible before transferring in order to make timely progress to graduation.

PRE-MAJOR REQUIREMENTS:

  • Mathematics 3A, 3B (required prior to transfer - see Admission Selection Criteria above; these courses must be completed with grades of "C" or better)
  • Mathematics 4A, 4B (at least one of these courses or 6A required prior to transfer - see Admission Selection Criteria above; these courses must be completed with grades of "C" or better)
  • Mathematics 8* (must be completed with a grade of "C" or better)


*Note: Either Math 4A, 4B, 6A, or 6B must be completed with a grade of "B" or better in order to take MATH 8 at UCSB.

Note: Math 6A is a prerequisite for several upper-division mathematics courses. See the General Catalog.


PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR:

  • One course from Computer Science 8, 9, 16, or Engineering 3
  • Physics 1 or 6A or 7A or 21

General Education Information: Students should focus on completing major preparation requirements. If time permits, students may also take courses to fulfill either UCSB General Education requirements or IGETC (Intersegmental General Education Transfer Curriculum). Students who will not complete IGETC prior to transfer should refer to the College of Engineering General Education articulation agreement. UCSB's General Education requirements do not need to be completed prior to transfer, but students who choose to follow College of Engineering General Education should complete two to three General Education courses prior to transfer. For more information concerning satisfaction of UCSB General Education requirements, student may also refer to the General Engineering Academic Requirements (GEAR) publication.

Please visit the department's website to learn more about this major: www.me.ucsb.edu


ADMISSION SELECTION CRITERIA: To be admitted to the Mechanical Engineering major, all transfer applicants must complete the equivalent of the following REQUIRED courses (in addition to general admission requirements) by the end of spring prior to transfer with no grades lower than "C". Applicants with a major prep GPA of 3.5 or higher are the most competitive for admission.


REQUIRED for admission (all of these courses must be completed with no grades lower than "C")

  • Math 3A, 3B, 4A, 4B
  • Physics 7A, 7B, 7C, 7L
  • Chemistry 1A, 2AL
  • Engineering 3*
  • Mechanical Engineering 14


*For students who are unable to complete a course articulating with Engineering 3, we will accept a course articulating with Computer Science 8 or 9 or 16 instead of Engineering 3, for admission purposes only. Computer Science 8 or 9 or 16 do not satisfy a major requirement and the student would still need to take Engineering 3 at UCSB if admitted. (See Computer Science "by Department" listing for CMPSC 8 or 9 or 16 articulations.)


STRONGLY RECOMMENDED advanced preparation courses all of these courses must be completed with no grades lower than "C")

  • Chemistry 1B
  • Math 6A, 6B
  • Mechanical Engineering 6, 10, 15, 16*
  • Physics 7D*

Note: Students should take as many of the Strongly Recommended courses as possible before transferring in order to make timely progress to graduation.


*Admitted applicants who have completed the equivalent to ME 16 "Dynamics" and PHYS 7D may be able to complete their degree in 2 years rather than 3.


Additional major preparation courses

  • Mechanical Engineering 12S, 17


Students are strongly encouraged to complete a series (such as general chemistry or physics) at a single school to avoid missing content.

PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR:

  • Two courses from the following: History 2A, 2B, 4A, 4B


(Transfer applicants do not need to complete all Preparation for the Major in order to be admitted, but should complete as much as possible before transferring so they will be prepared to progress in the major at UCSB.)


Note: A reading knowledge of Latin and a modern European language will be necessary for those pursuing graduate programs. However, it is not required for the major.

Breadth Requirements: Most of the Discipline Distribution Breadth Requirement and Area Distribution Breadth Requirement will be fulfilled after transfer with upper-division courses, but one lower-division transfer course can apply to one of these requirements. Articulated community college courses are all lower-division, so only the lower-division options are listed here. There are many upper-division options at UCSB.


A. Discipline Distribution Breadth Requirement (five courses from at least three different areas, but most or all of that will be completed after transfer)

A-1) History: History 2B, 4A, 4B, 46A, 49A

A-2) Art, Architecture or Music (image, sound, material objects): History of Art and Architecture 6M

A-3) Literature or Written Culture (text, writing): Comparative Literature 30A, 50A; Chinese 80; French 50AX

A-4) Religion, Philosophy or Science: Chinese 48; Philosophy 20B; Religious Studies 4, 23, 26, 27, 33, 47, 48, 73, 80B


B. Area Distribution Breadth Requirement (four courses from at least 2 different areas/diaspora, but most or all of that will be completed after transfer)

B-1) Africa: History 2B, 49A

B-2) Byzantium/Eastern Christendom: no lower-division options

B-3) East Asia: Religious Studies 4, 23, 47, 48, 73

B-4) Europe: Comparative Literature 30A, 50A; French 50AX; History 2B, 4B; History of Art and Architecture 6M

B-5) Islamicate World: History 2B, 46A; Philosophy 20B

B-6) Jewish Studies: Religious Studies 26, 27

B-7) Mediterranean: History 2B, 4A, 15

B-8) Latin America: no lower-division options

  2. Complete sequence of major-applicable General Biology with laboratory, with no individual grade lower than "C"
  3.   4. One-year sequence of Organic Chemistry with laboratory with no individual grade lower than "C" (first semester/quarter must be completed by fall prior to transfer)

The Department of Music offers two undergraduate degree programs: the Bachelor of Arts in Music Studies (B.A.) and the Bachelor of Music (B.M.). The Bachelor of Arts in Music Studies is an innovative program focusing on the academic study of music as a social, cultural and historical practice. The degree includes a required performance component in addition to advanced coursework in Music History, Ethnomusicology, and Music Theory.


All incoming Music Studies, B.A. majors must take a placement test in written theory skills and aural skills. In addition, students must audition for admission to performance classes. All Music Studies, B.A. students are required to register for Music 2, 3C, and 12


Performance ensembles are available for all qualified students (including non-majors) pending audition. Ensembles include Wind Ensemble, Chamber Music, several ethnomusicology ensembles, as well as Choirs, Chamber Orchestra, Opera and Piano Ensembles.


For further information about UCSB's Music Studies major, please contact:


Department of Music

Room 1314 Music Building

University of California

Santa Barbara, CA 93106-6070

Website: www.music.ucsb.edu

Please visit the department's website to learn more about this major: www.music.ucsb.edu


PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR

  • Music 2
  • Music 3C
  • Music 4A (or by placement exam)
  • Music 5A (or by placement exam)
  • Music 5B (or by placement exam)
  • Music 12
  • Music 17
  • Three courses from: Music 8, 20-33, 88, A34 through A70AA-ZZ
  • One elective course from the following (other courses may also be considered by petition): Music 4B, 5C, 6, 8, 11, 15, 16, 20A, 31A


Note: A grade of C- or better is required to advance in the Music 4 and Music 5 series.


Note: Most performance and ensemble classes at UCSB are open by audition only. Auditions for classes should be taken at the Entrance Auditions before admission (information and dates are available from the program advisor in the music department) or at the beginning of each quarter.


(Transfer applicants do not need to complete all Preparation for the Major in order to be admitted, but should complete as much as possible before transferring so they will be prepared to progress in the major at UCSB.)

The Department of Music offers two undergraduate degree programs: the Bachelor of Arts in Music Studies (B.A.) and the Bachelor of Music (B.M.). The Bachelor of Arts in Music Studies is an innovative program focusing on the academic study of music as a social, cultural and historical practice. The degree includes a required performance component in addition to advanced coursework in Music History, Ethnomusicology, and Music Theory.


All incoming Music Studies, B.A. majors must take a placement test in written theory skills and aural skills. In addition, students must audition for admission to performance classes. All Music Studies, B.A. students are required to register for Music 2, 3C, and 12


Performance ensembles are available for all qualified students (including non-majors) pending audition. Ensembles include Wind Ensemble, Chamber Music, several ethnomusicology ensembles, as well as Choirs, Chamber Orchestra, Opera and Piano Ensembles.

ADMISSION SELECTION CRITERIA: To be admitted to Physics, B.A. or Physics, B.S., transfer applicants must complete the following (in addition to general admission requirements):


  1. Complete the UC Transfer Pathway in Physics *
  2. Earn at least a 3.4 GPA in the UC Transfer Pathway in Physics* courses with no grade lower than C


*These are the UC Transfer Pathway in Physics courses:

  • Physics 21-22-23-24-25 and 20AL-BL-CL (Calculus-based physics for scientists and engineers)**
  • Mathematics 3A-3B (Single variable calculus)
  • Mathematics 4A (Linear algebra)

**Advanced Placement (AP) exams and International Baccalaureate (IB) exams will not satisfy any part of the Physics course requirements.

ADDITIONAL MAJOR PREPARATION COURSES (may be taken after transfer):

  • Mathematics 6B (recommended to be completed prior to transfer)
  • Physics 29
  • Two science electives, chosen from the following, or in consultation with a faculty advisor: Astronomy 1, 2; Chemistry 1A, 1B; Earth 2, 9, 11, 20; EEMB 22; MCDB 20; PSTAT 10


** Students must earn a minimum grade of C in all major-applicable courses in order to satisfy UCSB major requirements **

Department of Ecology, Evolution, and Marine Biology (EEMB) majors:

  • Aquatic Biology, B.S.
  • Biological Sciences, B.A. & B.S.
  • Ecology and Evolution, B.S.
  • Physiology, B.S.
  • Zoology, B.S.


Department of Molecular, Cellular, and Developmental Biology (MCDB) majors:

  • Biological Sciences, B.A. & B.S.
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S.
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Biochemistry-Molecular Biology Emphasis
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Cell and Developmental Biology Emphasis
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Microbiology Emphasis
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Pharmacology Emphasis


PRE-MAJOR INFORMATION - Students are admitted initially to Pre-Biological Sciences if they applied to any of these majors, not directly to the major. Admission to the full major is contingent upon achievement of a grade point average of 2.0 or better in pertinent courses completed at the University of California. Because the criteria are subject to annual review and revision, interested students should consult the department directly to obtain current information regarding specific additional criteria for admission to the full major.

**Admission to the pre-major does not guarantee admission to full major status**

ADMISSION SELECTION CRITERIA - To be admitted to the Pre-Biological Sciences major, all transfer students must complete the following (in addition to general admission requirements) by the end of spring prior to transfer:


  1. One-year sequence of General Chemistry with laboratory, with no individual grade lower than "C"
  2. Complete sequence of major-applicable General Biology with laboratory, with no individual grade lower than "C"
  3. Calculus courses articulating with UCSB's MATH 3A-3B or MATH 34A-34B with no individual grade lower than "C" (first semester/quarter must be completed by fall prior to transfer; a single course articulating with both MATH 34A and 34B is acceptable and it may be in progress in winter or spring prior to transfer)*
  4. One-year sequence of Organic Chemistry with laboratory with no individual grade lower than "C" (first semester/quarter must be completed by fall prior to transfer)
  5. A cumulative GPA of 2.7 or better in the required courses listed above (letter grades required)


*[Applicants intending to major in Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Biochemistry-Molecular Biology Emphasis should take courses articulating with MATH 3A-3B rather than MATH 34A-34B if possible. MATH 34A-34B would be acceptable for admission, but MATH 3A-3B are required to complete the major.]


Note: In order to make normal major progress, before transferring we also strongly recommend the completion of one year of general physics with laboratory, and a statistics course or advanced math. Any of these courses completed with a grade lower than "C" might not satisfy course prerequisites at UCSB.

Please visit the department's website to learn more about this major: www.lifesci.ucsb.edu


PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR:


  • Chemistry 1A-1B-1C-2AL-2BL or Chemistry 1A-1AL-1B-1BL-1C-1CL (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • MCDB 1A-1B-1LL and EEMB 2-2LL-3 (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • Chemistry 6AL and 109A-109B-109C (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • Mathematics 3A-3B or 34A-34B (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • One of the following: PSTAT 5LS or PSTAT 5A (Mathematics 4A is acceptable but not recommended)

All transfer applicants must satisfy University of California admissions eligibility requirements as well as meeting campus admission selection criteria. Completing the UC transfer admission requirements in English and mathematics by the end of the fall term prior to the fall application quarter makes an applicant more competitive for admission to UCSB. All admission requirements must be completed by the end of spring prior to transfer. For more information on UC admissions eligibility requirements and admission to UCSB, please visit the Admissions website: www.admissions.ucsb.edu


This articulation agreement lists course-to-course or sequence-to-sequence substitutions for preparation in the major. Transfer students are strongly encouraged to complete as many major preparatory courses as possible prior to enrolling at UCSB. Completion of all major preparatory courses is not an admissions requirement, but some majors require certain courses to be completed prior to transfer with a specified GPA. Completion or near completion of major preparatory courses will help students move more efficiently toward graduation after transfer.


Please note that the course "equivalencies" do not necessarily apply to UCSB general education. For information concerning satisfaction of UCSB general education requirements, please refer to the General Education/Breadth articulation agreement.


Advanced Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) exams may or may not be used to meet course requirements, depending on the exam. Please refer to the AP Chart and IB Chart in the UCSB General Catalog for information on how we use AP and IB exams.

Please visit the department's website to learn more about this major: www.polsci.ucsb.edu


PRE-MAJOR INFORMATION

Students are admitted initially to Pre-Political Science, not directly to the major. To qualify for admission into full major status, students must complete three courses from Political Science 1, 6, 7, and 12, as well as Political Science 15 with a UC grade point average of 2.6 or above in those courses completed at the University of California. (Only UC grades go into the pre-major GPA. Transfer courses taken outside of UC may satisfy pre-major requirements, but they are not part of the pre-major GPA.) Economics 1 and 2 (or 9) must also be completed on a letter graded basis and are included in the overall major GPA, but are excluded from the pre-major grade-point average computation. Because the criteria are subject to annual review and revision, transfer students should consult the department directly to obtain current information regarding specific additional criteria for admission to the full major. Admission to the pre-major does not guarantee admission to full major status.


PRE-MAJOR COURSES

  • Three courses from the following: Political Science 1, 6, 7, 12
  • Political Science 15


PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR

  • Economics 1 and 2, or Economics 9


(Transfer applicants do not need to complete all of the Pre-Major Courses in order to be admitted, but should complete as much as possible before transferring so they will be prepared to progress in the major at UCSB.)

PRE-MAJOR INFORMATION

Students are admitted initially to Pre-Psychological and Brain Sciences, not directly to the major. Admission to the full Psychological and Brain Sciences major is contingent upon fulfilling the following requirements:

  1. The courses in Area I must be completed with a grade point average of 2.7 or higher in courses completed at the University of California
  2. The courses in Area II must be completed with a grade point average of 2.0 or higher in courses completed at the University of California
  3. All courses must be completed on a letter-grade basis
  4. No course with a grade lower than C- in Area I & II
  5. Not more than one course with a C- in Area I & II


Only UC grades go into the Pre-Major GPA. Transfer courses taken outside of UC may satisfy Pre-Major requirements, but they are not part of the Pre-Major GPA.


Because the criteria are subject to annual review and revision, transfer students should contact the department to obtain current information regarding specific additional criteria for admission to the full major.

**Admission to the pre-major does not guarantee admission to full major status**

PRE-MAJOR REQUIREMENTS

Area I courses:

  • Psychology 1*
  • Mathematics 34A (or 3A)*
  • PSTAT 5A or equivalent*
  • Psychology 10A and 10B (must be taken at UCSB)*

Area II courses:

  • Chemistry 1A-1B*
  • MCDB 6 and EEMB 7 (or MCDB 1A and EEMB 2)

*Students must complete PSY 1, MATH 34A (or 3A), PSTAT 5A or equivalent, and CHEM 1A-1B prior to enrolling in PSY 10A; PSY 10A is a prerequisite for PSY 10B. Transfer students should complete these courses prior to transfer so they can take PSY 10A at UCSB as soon as possible after transfer.


PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR

Note: The following courses are not required to be admitted into the major, but are required to complete the major:

Area III courses:

  • Four courses from the following: Anthropology 2, 5, 7; Chemistry 1C; Computer Science 8, 16; Earth Science 2, 3; Economics 1, 2, 9; EEMB 3; Environmental Studies 1, 2, 3; Geography 5; Linguistics 20, 50, 70; MCDB 1B, 20; Mathematics 4A, 4B, 34B (or 3B); Philosophy 3, 4; Physics 1, 2, 3, 6A, 6B, 6C, 7A, 7B, 21; Political Science 1

PRE-MAJOR INFORMATION


Students are admitted initially to Pre-Sociology, not directly to the major. Admission to the full major is contingent upon completion of the pre-major courses with a grade point average of at least 2.3 in courses completed at the University of California. (Only UC grades go into the pre-major GPA. Transfer courses taken outside of UC may satisfy pre-major requirements, but they are not part of the pre-major GPA.) Courses in the preparation for the major will not be included in the pre-major GPA computation but must be take for a letter grade and will influence the overall major GPA.

**Admission to the pre-major does not guarantee admission to full major status**


  • Students must complete all pre-major and preparation for the major courses for letter grades and achieve the minimum GPA requirements
  • Courses in the pre-major must be completed with a grade of "C-" or higher


Because the criteria are subject to annual review and revision, transfer students should consult the department directly to obtain current information regarding specific additional criteria for admission into the full major.

PRE-MAJOR REQUIREMENTS

  • Sociology 1
  • Sociology 10
  • One course from CMPSC 5A; Communication 87; PSTAT 5A, 5LS
  • Two courses from: History 2C, 4C, 8A, 8B, 17B, 17C


PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR

  • Social Science Breadth Requirement: One course from the following: Anthropology 2, 7; Economics 2; Environmental Studies 2, 3; Geography 5; History 7, 17A; Philosophy 3, 4, 7; Political Science 1, 6, 7, 12; Psychology 1
  • Diversity Requirement: One course from the following: Asian American Studies 1, 2, 8; Black Studies 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 50; Chicana/o Studies 1A-B-C; Feminist Studies 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 80


NOTE: If a 2-semester US History series articulates with UCSB's History 17A-B-C series, then that 2-semester series can satisfy History 17A for the Social Science Breadth Requirement and also satisfy History 17B and 17C for the Pre-Major Requirements.


(Transfer applicants do not need to complete all of the Pre-Major Requirements in order to be admitted, but should complete as much as possible before transferring so they will be prepared to progress in the major at UCSB.)

One of the following language series: Second Language Learners or Heritage Speakers


Second Language Learners

PRE-MAJOR INFORMATION


Students are admitted initially to Pre-Statistics and Data Science, not directly to the major. To be admitted to the full major, students must complete all pre-major courses with a 2.5 or higher UC grade-point average (in courses completed at the University of California). All pre-major courses must be completed with a grade of "C" or better. (Only UC grades go into the pre-major GPA. Transfer courses taken outside of UC may satisfy pre-major requirements, but they are not part of the pre-major GPA.) Students are permitted to repeat a maximum of two pre-major courses. Only one repeat is allowed in each course. Preparation courses are excluded from the pre-major GPA, but will apply to the overall major GPA. Students must complete Computer Science 8 and either 9 or 16 with a grade of "C" or better. Only one repeat is allowed in each preparation for the major and pre-major requirement. Because the criteria are subject to annual review and revision, transfer students should consult the department directly to obtain current information regarding specific additional criteria for admission to the full major.

**Admission to the pre-major does not guarantee admission to full major status.**

PRE-MAJOR

  • Mathematics 3A, 3B, 4A, 4B, 6A (these courses must be completed with grades of "C" or better)
  • Mathematics 8* or PSTAT 8* (must be completed with a grade of "C" or better)
  • PSTAT 10 (must be completed with a grade of "C" or better)


*Note: Either MATH 4A, 4B, 6A, or 6B must be completed with a grade of "B" or better in order to take MATH 8 or PSTAT 8 at UCSB.

*Note: MATH 8 is a prerequisite for all upper-division Mathematics courses except MATH 117, 104A, 104B, and 104C. If you plan to take additional upper-division Mathematics courses, you must take MATH 8.


PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR

  • Computer Science 8 (must be completed with a grade of "C" or better)
  • Computer Science 9 or 16 (must be completed with a grade of "C" or better)


Note: CMPSC 9 is recommended over CMPSC 16. Also, students cannot get credit for CMPSC 8 at UCSB if transferring in credit for CMPSC 9 or 16, so please see the Department advisors in such instances.


(Transfer applicants do not need to complete all Pre-Major and Preparation for the Major courses in order to be admitted, but should complete as much as possible before transferring so they will be prepared to progress in the major at UCSB.)

Advisory note for fall 2027 applicants to Statistics and Data Science, B.A. (October-November 2026 application filing period)


NEW ADMISSION SELECTION CRITERIA FOR FALL 2027: Transfer applicants must complete the following (in addition to general admission requirements) with a minimum 2.75 GPA in these courses, with no grade lower than C. (Letter grades are required.)

  • Calculus 1 and Calculus 2 (courses articulating with UCSB's MATH 3A and 3B)
  • Linear algebra (UCSB's MATH 4A)
  • Multivariable calculus (UCSB's MATH 6A)
  • One computer programming course (UCSB's CMPSC 8 or 9 or 16)

The Department of Theater and Dance offers three theater degrees at the undergraduate level: a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Theater-Acting Emphasis, a Bachelor of Arts in Theater, and a Bachelor of Arts in Theater-Theater Design Emphasis. All programs require completion of core courses in dramatic literature.


The B.F.A. program prepares students for professional theater, professional conservatory programs, and Master of Fine Arts programs. Students must audition for admittance to the highly selective B.F.A. program and are continually reevaluated on their demonstrated ability, commitment, and potential talent.


The B.A. programs (Theater, B.A. and Theater, B.A.-Theater Design Emphasis) are more broadly based degrees, with a liberal arts orientation that allows students greater curricular choices. Theater, B.A. students will choose a concentration in Design, Directing, Playwriting, Theater and Community, or Theater and Performance Studies. Consult the Department of Theater and Dance website concerning additional requirements for the concentrations: https://www.theaterdance.ucsb.edu/undergraduate/theater-major-concentrations


The Department of Theater and Dance evaluates transfer work to determine completion of lower division requirements for each major.


For more information, please see the department website: www.theaterdance.ucsb.edu

PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR:

  • Theater 1
  • Two courses from: Theater 2A-B-C-D
  • Theater 5 or 19
  • Theater 7, 9, 22*, 23*, 24*, 25*, or 40
  • Two units Theater 29D and two additional units from 29A-B-C
  • Theater 49**
  • Theater 95


*Theater 19 is a prerequisite for Theater 23 , 24, and 25 and is recommended preparation for Theater 22.

**Theater Workshop equivalent courses will not automatically substitute for THTR 49 major credit until UCSB's Theater and Dance department verifies that course topic was covered.


(Transfer applicants do not need to complete all Preparation for the Major in order to be admitted, but should complete as much as possible before transferring so they will be prepared to progress in the major at UCSB.)

general_texts:
All transfer applicants must satisfy University of California admissions eligibility requirements as well as meeting campus admission selection criteria. Completing the UC transfer admission requirements in English and mathematics by the end of the fall term prior to the fall application quarter makes an applicant more competitive for admission to UCSB. All admission requirements must be completed by the end of spring prior to transfer. For more information on UC admissions eligibility requirements and admission to UCSB, please visit the Admissions website: www.admissions.ucsb.edu


This articulation agreement lists course-to-course or sequence-to-sequence substitutions for preparation in the major. Transfer students are strongly encouraged to complete as many major preparatory courses as possible prior to enrolling at UCSB. Completion of all major preparatory courses is not an admissions requirement, but some majors require certain courses to be completed prior to transfer with a specified GPA. Completion or near completion of major preparatory courses will help students move more efficiently toward graduation after transfer.


Please note that the course "equivalencies" do not necessarily apply to UCSB general education. For information concerning satisfaction of UCSB general education requirements, please refer to the General Education/Breadth articulation agreement.


Advanced Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) exams may or may not be used to meet course requirements, depending on the exam. Please refer to the AP Chart and IB Chart in the UCSB General Catalog for information on how we use AP and IB exams.

The Department of Theater and Dance offers three theater degrees at the undergraduate level: a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Theater-Acting Emphasis, a Bachelor of Arts in Theater, and a Bachelor of Arts in Theater-Theater Design Emphasis. All programs require completion of core courses in dramatic literature.


The B.F.A. program prepares students for professional theater, professional conservatory programs, and Master of Fine Arts programs. Students must audition for admittance to the highly selective B.F.A. program and are continually reevaluated on their demonstrated ability, commitment, and potential talent.


The B.A. programs (Theater, B.A. and Theater, B.A.-Theater Design Emphasis) are more broadly based degrees, with a liberal arts orientation that allows students greater curricular choices. Theater, B.A. students will choose a concentration in Design, Directing, Playwriting, Theater and Community, or Theater and Performance Studies. Consult the Department of Theater and Dance website concerning additional requirements for the concentrations: https://www.theaterdance.ucsb.edu/undergraduate/theater-major-concentrations


The Department of Theater and Dance evaluates transfer work to determine completion of lower division requirements for each major.


For more information, please see the department website: www.theaterdance.ucsb.edu

PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR


A. Core Theater

  • Theater 1
  • Theater 19
  • Theater 29A-B-C (for a total of 3 units)
  • Two units of Theater 29D
  • Theater 95


B. Theater Design Focus

  • Theater 22, 23, 24, and 25
  • Four units from Theater 27A, 27B, 28 (Theater 28 is not in UCSB's catalog yet, but will be offered in the future)

Department of Ecology, Evolution, and Marine Biology (EEMB) majors:

  • Aquatic Biology, B.S.
  • Biological Sciences, B.A. & B.S.
  • Ecology and Evolution, B.S.
  • Physiology, B.S.
  • Zoology, B.S.


Department of Molecular, Cellular, and Developmental Biology (MCDB) majors:

  • Biological Sciences, B.A. & B.S.
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S.
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Biochemistry-Molecular Biology Emphasis
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Cell and Developmental Biology Emphasis
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Microbiology Emphasis
  • Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Pharmacology Emphasis


PRE-MAJOR INFORMATION - Students are admitted initially to Pre-Biological Sciences if they applied to any of these majors, not directly to the major. Admission to the full major is contingent upon achievement of a grade point average of 2.0 or better in pertinent courses completed at the University of California. Because the criteria are subject to annual review and revision, interested students should consult the department directly to obtain current information regarding specific additional criteria for admission to the full major.

**Admission to the pre-major does not guarantee admission to full major status**

ADMISSION SELECTION CRITERIA - To be admitted to the Pre-Biological Sciences major, all transfer students must complete the following (in addition to general admission requirements) by the end of spring prior to transfer:


  1. One-year sequence of General Chemistry with laboratory, with no individual grade lower than "C"
  2. Complete sequence of major-applicable General Biology with laboratory, with no individual grade lower than "C"
  3. Calculus courses articulating with UCSB's MATH 3A-3B or MATH 34A-34B with no individual grade lower than "C" (first semester/quarter must be completed by fall prior to transfer; a single course articulating with both MATH 34A and 34B is acceptable and it may be in progress in winter or spring prior to transfer)*
  4. One-year sequence of Organic Chemistry with laboratory with no individual grade lower than "C" (first semester/quarter must be completed by fall prior to transfer)
  5. A cumulative GPA of 2.7 or better in the required courses listed above (letter grades required)


*[Applicants intending to major in Molecular and Cellular Biology, B.S. - Biochemistry-Molecular Biology Emphasis should take courses articulating with MATH 3A-3B rather than MATH 34A-34B if possible. MATH 34A-34B would be acceptable for admission, but MATH 3A-3B are required to complete the major.]


Note: In order to make normal major progress, before transferring we also strongly recommend the completion of one year of general physics with laboratory, and a statistics course or advanced math. Any of these courses completed with a grade lower than "C" might not satisfy course prerequisites at UCSB.

Please visit the department's website to learn more about this major: www.lifesci.ucsb.edu


PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR:


  • Chemistry 1A-1B-1C-2AL-2BL or Chemistry 1A-1AL-1B-1BL-1C-1CL (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • MCDB 1A-1B-1LL and EEMB 2-2LL-3 (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • Mathematics 3A-3B or 34A-34B (required prior to transfer, see Admission Selection Criteria above)
  • One of the following: PSTAT 5LS or PSTAT 5A (Mathematics 4A is acceptable but not recommended)
  • Physics 6A-6AL-6B-6BL-6C-6CL


Note: Organic chemistry is also required prior to transfer for admission, see Admission Selection Criteria above

Note: Organic chemistry may be required by some graduate or professional schools. Consult with an advisor.
